What do you have to gain when your apps are open and free anyway?

review.review_title: I'm impressed! Best note taking app ever!
review.review_text: Seamlessly syncs across multiple devices, love the simple format, and you can restore your notes to an earlier time (on desktop version, couldn't find a way to do it on the mobile), within minutes. I accidentally erased a note on my mobile (if I had just deleted it, it would be in the trash folder), and I was able to go back 15 minutes and had my note back....lifesaver. So much easier imo than any of the other syncable notes apps out there.

I thought I'd finally found the notes app that would serve my needs by allowing me to synchronize notes on my phone and my computer. But I just found out that I cannot paste anything into a note on the phone app! This is a major shortcoming. I'll keep it on my phone for a short time to see if the developer adds this option. ADDED NOTE: I just discovered that, while the Paste command won't pop up on a new, blank note, it will in notes that already have text.

I will be typing and then think that I may have mistyped the word, but I cannot read it because it is hidden beneath that icon. It would be awesome if the icon went away if you're not actively touching the screen. I would assume that is what would happen as other applications hide the buttons when you're not actively trying to press the buttons. It kind of takes away from the application itself, at least for me. I would be using this on a daily basis, but I think I am going to have to find an application that doesn't stop me from being able to read what I am writing. It's such a small thing, but it really takes away from the writing experience.

But for you who just need to write down important text notes, which you can look up for whenever you want, offline and online. No app is doing it better than Simplenote. Combine it with its web app, and the third party app Resophnotes for Windows. Your note taking experience is complete and seamless. review.review_title: Seamlessly integrates across web/tablet, simple but elegant user interface
review.review_text: There are a lot of note-taking apps out there, spanning the gamut between simplicity and feature-richness. Most of them are tailored for a specific type of user, and this one strikes a sweet spot for me. I mostly take notes on my tablet and later, after they have synchronized to the cloud, I organize them and, in certain case, copy them elsewhere. Simplenote allows me to do so seamlessly. Both the tablet and the web application are exercises in simple yet effective design. I very much like the possibility of publishing notes to the internet with a single push of a button, and also the markdown capabilities that allow for putting headlines, bold, italics, links, etc. into documents without being tied into a proprietary binary format like with other word processors or rich text editors. The tag-based organization structure takes some getting used to, but it's definitely a more extensible way of organizing one's notes across different themes and associations. I've searched for a good note-taking app for years, and now, it seems, the hunt is over.

It works good on my Mac running Mavericks, also good on my iPad running iOS 7. But I can't trust it on Android. ** update 6/18/2014 ** I just reinstalled it on my Galaxy Note 3 and my Android tablet. A note I had taken, that was updated, showed as updated on the phone, but not the tablet (it was, and still is, updated on my Mac). Later I checked the phone, and the update had been removed. Grr. The whole point of this app is to seamlessly keep everything in sync, everywhere. It totally fails at this. Looking for an alternative.

review.review_text: Update #2: 2/6/2014: It appears that SimpleNote can't sync, it gets caught in a loop and eats my battery. Restarting the phone and it syncs pretty quickly. Update: 2/6/2014: I have now experienced a sync issue -- I edit some text on my phone, and then look for it in the browser a minute or two later and it has not updated. Neither refreshing the page nor closing & reopening the app force a sync -- and there is no way to force a sync that I can see. ------ I have not experienced any sync or data loss issues with this app and the web app and have tested it multiple ways. Can someone who is post some steps to reproduce the problem? I wish the app let you swipe to the right while in a note to go back to the list of notes. review.review_title: Best text editor / note-organizer for Android
review.review_text: You can use Simplenote (from Automattic, Inc.; developers and creaters of WordPress)to write short notes, medium-length poems or top 10 lists, or loooong essays or articles. All texts can be found in Simplenote's main document list. Everything is furthermore synced to other devices that support Simplenote. You can tag all text documents with single words you feel describe them, so you can search for the tag words in the future. Simple GUI, functional design - great app.

Tag names are not being edited. There are many bugs in this app even after many updates. Also, many basic note making features are missing in this app. The idea and UI are good but very poor execution.

review.review_title: Using Glance Note Instead Until They Stabilize the Syncing
review.review_text: Researched. Rejected these: Evernote ... not all of its notes are available offline. SpringPad ... no way to backup your notes. Google Keep ... no way to backup notes, and no tagging. So I decided to go with simplenote. It didn't have photos or audio notes, but I value importing and backing up much higher. The web portal for it is also pretty good. Everything looked good until one day I noticed that it was repeating chunks of some of my notes, sometimes 10 times -- when viewed through their web portal. And then about a week later I noticed that it has also erased some of my content. So, about 2 weeks ago, I began using the app Glance Note, which accesses your Simplenote data online. I figure I can keep using it until Simplenote gets their app figured out. It's not as nice as simplenote ( it takes two taps to edit a note, and tagging is clumsy), but so far, it hasn't messed up any of my notes. And that's what I find most important in a Notes app. Hoping these guys get SimpleNote working well!
Network network protocol

I'm an Evernote refugee who was attracted by Simplenote's promise of a clean interface and rock-solid sync. And the iOS and OS X apps deliver on that promise. Unfortunately, even over multiple update cycles, the Android app on my stock (non-rooted) KitKat Nexus 7 loses note data constantly. The steps to reproduce are simple: Start writing a note, then switch away to another app or to the home screen. Upon returning, more often than not, you'll find that a portion of the note (sometimes a large portion) has been lost. Gorgeous app, but one star for not being able to master the basic requirement of retaining my data.

So far Minutes serve my needs very well. The best feature is the in-note and review_title search which auto highlights all results.

I was ready for this to be a crummy iOS port. Initially, it had issues with sync & battery drain, but after emailing Automattic, they responded the next day that those issues were fixed. Simplenote has no note length limit (unlike Google Keep) and the web version supports Markdown - the canonical method to format text without dealing with a rich text editor. Sync is nearly instantaneous, and I use it for a combination of lecture notes, as well as minor tidbits of info I might forget. It handles both tasks perfectly. If you're looking for a great cross platform note taking solution that's lightweight, this is the app to go with. It's a cross between Evernote and Keep, but one that keeps the best of both worlds.
So far I like the app, but I'd like to see two new features: 1) highlight search terms 2) offer a fixed width font

That and as many people have requested, a widget. I know this is an early effort and will get better over time, I look forward to seeing that development!

But seriously, no room for improvement on the app? 5 stars across the board? I like the enthusiasm, honestly. I have used the app, and only for a day so far, and I'm glad that it's better than all the simplenote compatible apps out there. Are you guys going to be adding a feature for sharing/publishing to the web from your phone and optionally emailing a link? That's pretty handy and I always enjoy(ed) doing this in the iOS platform when I needed to share information quickly, and then remove it once I knew the party had copied the needed information. Yes, I know the share option is there, but it still didn't allow for publishing the actual note and leaving it published via that link that others can connect to later. I still have to do that from the web, and that's a convenience I'd rather have in the app. There are 3 options I would like, since I have a ton of notes and the convenience could simply be added as a future option, or set of options. 1> Alternating row theme, as a settings option. 2> Highlight the search section on a per-note basis if enabled in settings. (Call out the sentence with the word(s) you searched for) 3> Tap and hold to [un]share/publish/delete, etc.
